answers.answer: Gave birth to my son at 37 weeks. Vaginal birth with epidural. He came home with me after 2 days and is a happy healthy 6 yr old.
Delivered vaginally at 36. He was 7lbs 9 oz cane home with me, no issues
Delivered my son at 37 weeks. Had no pain medication whatsoever.  He came home with me the next day and was happy and healthy.  He weighed 6 lbs 3 ounces.
At 36 weeks you're considered full term hunny. Don't be nervous. I'm 37 weeks friday
I had my first child at 37 weeks when my water broke. I had an epidural and everything went smoothly. My son weighed just under 7lbs and was very healthy.

I have a cousin who delivered Via c-section at 35 weeks. She had preeclampsia and was in and out of the hospital for a few weeks and was on bed rest too before the baby came. Her little girl weighed 5 lbs and is very healthy.

My last baby is two now ...came at 36 weeks unexpected and had an epidural... She was perfect 6lbs 13 oz but lost 13 oz in the hospital and her blood sugar was low in the beginning but after getting formula to help she was fine ... And went home in like. 2 days total, she did end back in the hospital two weeks later due to high bilirubin but was fine after a night or two since then she's been completely healthy !

question: Has anyone delivered at 37 or a lil earlier, if so was it natural or c-section, did you have e epidural and was it successful. I have had my two doses of steroids and will be delivering at 37 weeks . I am 33 weeks and 1day. I'm worried but doctor says she's activate and it's due to mild preeclampsia.
